intro: Pterochloris humbertiana, commonly known as the Humbert's spurge, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
